intro: Sabdariffa rubra, commonly known as roselle, is a flowering plant native to Africa and tropical Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant red calyces that encase the yellowish flowers, which are used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often used as a vegetable, while the calyces are dried and used to make tea. Sabdariffa rubra is also valued for its high content of antioxidants and flavonoids.
